meanings.definition: A unit of magnetic induction equal to 1000 gauss.
meanings.sent1: The magnet produced a kilogauss of magnetic force.
meanings.sent2: Scientists measured the magnetic field in kilogauss units.
meanings.sent3: The fridge magnet was so strong, it felt like a kilogauss pulling on it.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered with a kilogauss of intensity, ready to unleash their power.
meanings.sent5: The MRI machine generated a kilogauss field, revealing the inner workings of the body.

meanings.definition: A measurement of magnetic field strength.
meanings.sent1: The device displayed the reading in kilogauss for the magnetic field strength.
meanings.sent2: The kilogauss level indicated the strength of the magnet's pull.
meanings.sent3: The compass needle went crazy, pointing in all directions due to the kilogauss around it.
meanings.sent4: The magnetic storm reached a kilogauss, disrupting all electronic devices in its path.
meanings.sent5: The scientist recorded the kilogauss measurement to analyze the magnetic field changes over time.
